title: "Consider importing one of these" diagnostic should perhaps not suggest `use` statements from the parent module

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

body:
```
use unicode_segmentation::UnicodeSegmentation; // 1.7.1;

mod foo {
    fn foo<T: UnicodeSegmentation>(){}
}
```

([playpen](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=8c9a56f90c59b48525d7407f36153fac))

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0405]: cannot find trait `UnicodeSegmentation` in this scope
 --> src/lib.rs:4:15
  |
4 |     fn foo<T: UnicodeSegmentation>(){}
  |               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ not found in this scope
  |
help: consider importing one of these items
  |
4 |     use crate::UnicodeSegmentation;
  |
4 |     use unicode_segmentation::UnicodeSegmentation;
  |
```

It's not really standard style to reuse _private_ `use` statements from other modules, at least not in my experience. Should the suggestion filter these out?


cc @estebank
